string-array.item: Ivan Barbashev was selected by the Blues in the second round, 33rd overall, of the 2014 NHL Entry Draft.
Tyler Bozak is a self-described late bloomer, he is a 6-foot-1, 195-pound center who has fashioned a solid NHL career.
Logan Brown was traded to St. Louis by Ottawa with a conditional pick in the 2022 NHL Draft for Zach Sanford.
Pavel Buchnevich was from the New York Rangers development camp. He made it clear he was ready for the challenges that awaited him in his first season in North America.
Dakota Joshua was traded to St. Louis by Toronto for future considerations on July 12, 2019.
Klim Kostin was drafted by the Blues in the 2017 draft, as the 31st overall pick.
Jordan Kyrou, a Toronto native, was selected in the second round at pick 35 of the 2016 NHL Draft.

Ryan OReilly had a record shattering first season with the Blues after being acquired in 2018. He led the Blues in scoring during the regular season 77 points. 28 being goals, and the other 49 being assists.
David Perron got the Stanley Cup championship with the St. Louis Blues after being acquired from the Vegas Golden Knights during the 2019 season.

Brandon Saad is the son of a Syrian immigrant and a grandson of a former NFL official who worked two Super Bowls. As you can tell, he does not come from a hockey background. At a young age though, he knew he would grow up to be an NHL star.
Brayden Schenn is a high paid center who was eligible to become a restricted free agent after the 2015-16 season. He finished with 44 points in the final 46 games for the Philadelphia Flyers.

Oskar Sundqvist got his name on the Stanley Cup in 2019 after being a regular on the fourth line for the St. Louis Blues. He contributed nine points (four goals, five assists) and played solid defense during the Blues Stanley Cup run.

Vladimir Tarasenko is spectacular right winger with amazing one-on-one skills, speed, and finishing prowess. His skills have helped him get compared to Hockey Hall of Fame center Sergei Fedorov. He wears No. 91 in tribute to his fellow Russian.

Robert Thomas was picked at Number 20 in the first round by the St. Louis Blues in the 2017 NHL Draft. He stepped into their lineup as a 19-year-old and made himself right at home. The native of Aurora, Ontario, played 70 games as a rookie in 2018-19
Robert Bortuzzo is a physical defenseman who does not fill up the scoresheet, yet is a reliable puck-mover with a solid right-hand shot.

Justin Faulk lists his mother as the biggest influence on his hockey career. She took him skating when he was 3, and decided to take him back for another try a few months later after Justin failed so miserably during the initial attempt.
Torey Krug is an undersized NHl defenceman who went undrafted. Since making his name known in the 2013 Stanley Cup Playoffs, he has become a staple of the Blues defense.
Niko Mikkola, a finnish born defenceman acquired by the Blues in the 2015 draft at 127th overall (Rd 5, Pick 6).
Colton Parayko, 6-foot-6 and 226 pound defenceman that could fly under the radar. He was referred to as the St. Louis Blues secret weapon, helping the Blues win their first Stanley Cup.
Scott Perunovich is currently playing for the Springfield Thunderbirds as a prospect of the Blues, after being drafted 45th overall in the NHL Entry Draft.
Marco Scandella did not enjoy a smooth ride to success in the NHL. A second-round pick by the Minnesota Wild in the 2008 NHL Draft, the defenceman joined the "show" in the 2010-11 season.
Jake Wallman is currently playing for the Blues,after being picked 82nd overall in the NHL Entry Draft in 2014.

Jordan Binnington was 25 when the St. Louis Blues finally gave him a chance midway through the 2018-19 season. Eventually, Binnington helped the Blues achieve a Stanley Cup birth coming from dead last in their conference. With his help and the other players of the Blues, they would go on to win the Cup that season.

Ville Husso was a backup goalie for the Blues, and was on the practice squad during the 2019 Stanley Cup season. Due to several injury callups, he would eventually achieve his first opportunity to play in the NHL during the 2020-21 season. He went 9-6-1 with a 3.21 goals-against average, a .893 save percentage and one shutout in 17 games (15 starts) for the St. Louis Blues.
